intro: Eliokarmos rossouwii, commonly known as the Rossouw's elokarmos, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers, which are typically yellow to orange in color. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include narrow, hairy leaves and a compact growth habit, making it well-suited to its ecological niche. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
